item.title: R Study Notes
item.description: This is a collection of posts related to R.

item.title: Notes on the Constant Term in the Fixed Effect Model
item.description: In stata, the fixed effect model(xtreg y x1 x2 x3, fe) report a constant term. The underline estimate is \[y_{it} - \bar{yr} + \bar{\bar{y}} = a + (x_{it} - \bar{x_{i}} + \bar{\bar{x}})) \alpha + (\epsilon_{it} - \bar{e_i} + \bar{v})\] with the constrant \(\bar{v}\) equals to 0. Details can be found on Stata’s website. In R, plm package does not calculate the some whate artificial1 intercept for within models. see help(“within_intercept”, package = “plm”)↩

item.title: Hosting pages on Github using Rmarkdown and Hugo
item.description: My personal website is created by R package blogdown and Hugo1 and is hosted on Github. This page summarise my steps to setup the site. Creating github repositories Two respositories are needed for the site. I create blog_hugo to host Hugo’s content) I create <my-user-name>.github.io to host the public folder, which contains the static website. Installing Blogdown and Hugo Install blogdown. It is under heavy development when I write this blog.
